6930-75918-0000.flac.ground: CONCORD RETURNED TO ITS PLACE AMIDST THE TENTS
6930-75918-0000.flac.transcript: concord returned to its place amidst the tents

6930-75918-0001.flac.ground: THE ENGLISH FORWARDED TO THE FRENCH BASKETS OF FLOWERS OF WHICH THEY HAD MADE A PLENTIFUL PROVISION TO GREET THE ARRIVAL OF THE YOUNG PRINCESS THE FRENCH IN RETURN INVITED THE ENGLISH TO A SUPPER WHICH WAS TO BE GIVEN THE NEXT DAY
6930-75918-0001.flac.transcript: the english foled to the french baskets of flowers of which they had made a plentiable provision to greet the arrival of the young princess the french in return invited the english to a supper which was to be given the next day

6930-75918-0002.flac.ground: CONGRATULATIONS WERE POURED IN UPON THE PRINCESS EVERYWHERE DURING HER JOURNEY
6930-75918-0002.flac.transcript: congratulations were poured in upon the princess everywhere during her journey

6930-75918-0003.flac.ground: FROM THE RESPECT PAID HER ON ALL SIDES SHE SEEMED LIKE A QUEEN AND FROM THE ADORATION WITH WHICH SHE WAS TREATED BY TWO OR THREE SHE APPEARED AN OBJECT OF WORSHIP THE QUEEN MOTHER GAVE THE FRENCH THE MOST AFFECTIONATE RECEPTION FRANCE WAS HER NATIVE COUNTRY AND SHE HAD SUFFERED TOO MUCH UNHAPPINESS IN ENGLAND FOR ENGLAND TO HAVE MADE HER FORGET FRANCE
6930-75918-0003.flac.transcript: from the respect paid her on all sides she seemed like a queen and from the adoration with which she was treated by two or three she appeared an object of worship the queen mother gave the french the most affectionate reception france was her native country and she had suffered too much unhappiness in england for england to have made her forget france

6930-75918-0004.flac.ground: SHE TAUGHT HER DAUGHTER THEN BY HER OWN AFFECTION FOR IT THAT LOVE FOR A COUNTRY WHERE THEY HAD BOTH BEEN HOSPITABLY RECEIVED AND WHERE A BRILLIANT FUTURE OPENED BEFORE THEM
6930-75918-0004.flac.transcript: she taught her daughter then by her own affection for it that love for a country where they had both been hospitably received and were a brilliant future opened for them

6930-75918-0005.flac.ground: THE COUNT HAD THROWN HIMSELF BACK ON HIS SEAT LEANING HIS SHOULDERS AGAINST THE PARTITION OF THE TENT AND REMAINED THUS HIS FACE BURIED IN HIS HANDS WITH HEAVING CHEST AND RESTLESS LIMBS
6930-75918-0005.flac.transcript: the count had thrown himself back on his seat leaning his shoulders against the partition of the tent and remained thus his face buried in his hands with heaving chest and restless limbs

6930-75918-0006.flac.ground: THIS HAS INDEED BEEN A HARASSING DAY CONTINUED THE YOUNG MAN HIS EYES FIXED UPON HIS FRIEND
6930-75918-0006.flac.transcript: this has indeed been a harassing day continued the young man his eyes fixed upon his friend

6930-75918-0007.flac.ground: YOU WILL BE FRANK WITH ME I ALWAYS AM
6930-75918-0007.flac.transcript: you will be frank with me i always am

6930-75918-0008.flac.ground: CAN YOU IMAGINE WHY BUCKINGHAM HAS BEEN SO VIOLENT I SUSPECT
6930-75918-0008.flac.transcript: can you imagine why buckingham has been so violent i suspect

6930-75918-0009.flac.ground: IT IS YOU WHO ARE MISTAKEN RAOUL I HAVE READ HIS DISTRESS IN HIS EYES IN HIS EVERY GESTURE AND ACTION THE WHOLE DAY
6930-75918-0009.flac.transcript: it is you who are mistaken raoul i have read his distress in his eyes in his every gesture and action the whole day

6930-75918-0010.flac.ground: I CAN PERCEIVE LOVE CLEARLY ENOUGH
6930-75918-0010.flac.transcript: i can perceive love clearly enough

6930-75918-0011.flac.ground: I AM CONVINCED OF WHAT I SAY SAID THE COUNT
6930-75918-0011.flac.transcript: i am convinced of what i say said the count

6930-75918-0013.flac.ground: IN THOSE VERY TERMS I EVEN ADDED MORE
6930-75918-0013.flac.transcript: in those very terms i even added more

6930-75918-0014.flac.ground: BUT CONTINUED RAOUL NOT INTERRUPTED BY THIS MOVEMENT OF HIS FRIEND HEAVEN BE PRAISED THE FRENCH WHO ARE PRONOUNCED TO BE THOUGHTLESS AND INDISCREET RECKLESS EVEN ARE CAPABLE OF BRINGING A CALM AND SOUND JUDGMENT TO BEAR ON MATTERS OF SUCH HIGH IMPORTANCE
6930-75918-0014.flac.transcript: but continued raoul not interrupted by this movement of his friend heaven be praised the french who are pronounced to be thoughtless and indiscreet reckless even are capable of bringing a calm and sound judgment to bear on matters of such high importance

6930-75918-0015.flac.ground: THUS IT IS THAT THE HONOR OF THREE IS SAVED OUR COUNTRY'S OUR MASTER'S AND OUR OWN
6930-75918-0015.flac.transcript: thus it is that the honour of three is saved our country our masters and our own

6930-75918-0016.flac.ground: YES I NEED REPOSE MANY THINGS HAVE AGITATED ME TO DAY BOTH IN MIND AND BODY WHEN YOU RETURN TO MORROW I SHALL NO LONGER BE THE SAME MAN
6930-75918-0016.flac.transcript: yes i need repose many things have agitated me to day both in mind and body when you return to morrow i shall no longer be the same man

6930-75918-0017.flac.ground: BUT IN THIS FRIENDLY PRESSURE RAOUL COULD DETECT THE NERVOUS AGITATION OF A GREAT INTERNAL CONFLICT
6930-75918-0017.flac.transcript: but in this friendly pressure raoul could detect the nervous agitation of a great internal conflict

6930-75918-0018.flac.ground: THE NIGHT WAS CLEAR STARLIT AND SPLENDID THE TEMPEST HAD PASSED AWAY AND THE SWEET INFLUENCES OF THE EVENING HAD RESTORED LIFE PEACE AND SECURITY EVERYWHERE
6930-75918-0018.flac.transcript: the night was clear starlet and splendid the tempest had passed away and the sweet influences of the evening had restored life peace and security everywhere

6930-75918-0019.flac.ground: UPON THE LARGE SQUARE IN FRONT OF THE HOTEL THE SHADOWS OF THE TENTS INTERSECTED BY THE GOLDEN MOONBEAMS FORMED AS IT WERE A HUGE MOSAIC OF JET AND YELLOW FLAGSTONES
6930-75918-0019.flac.transcript: upon the large square in front of the hotel the shadows of the tents intersected by the golden moon beams formed as it were a huge mosaic of jet and yellow flagtones

6930-75918-0020.flac.ground: BRAGELONNE WATCHED FOR SOME TIME THE CONDUCT OF THE TWO LOVERS LISTENED TO THE LOUD AND UNCIVIL SLUMBERS OF MANICAMP WHO SNORED AS IMPERIOUSLY AS THOUGH HE WAS WEARING HIS BLUE AND GOLD INSTEAD OF HIS VIOLET SUIT
6930-75918-0020.flac.transcript: bragyon watched for some time the conduct of the two lovers listened to the loud and uncivil slumbers of manicampemp who snored as imperiously as though he was wearing his blue and gold instead of his violet suit

6930-76324-0001.flac.ground: THEY WERE CERTAINLY NO NEARER THE SOLUTION OF THEIR PROBLEM
6930-76324-0001.flac.transcript: there were certainly no near the solution of their problem

6930-76324-0002.flac.ground: THE POOR LITTLE THINGS CRIED CYNTHIA THINK OF THEM HAVING BEEN TURNED TO THE WALL ALL THESE YEARS
6930-76324-0002.flac.transcript: the poor little things cried cynthia think of them having been turned to the wall all these years

6930-76324-0003.flac.ground: NOW WHAT WAS THE SENSE OF IT TWO INNOCENT BABIES LIKE THAT
6930-76324-0003.flac.transcript: now what is the sense of it two innocent babies like that

6930-76324-0004.flac.ground: BUT JOYCE HAD NOT BEEN LISTENING ALL AT ONCE SHE PUT DOWN HER CANDLE ON THE TABLE AND FACED HER COMPANION
6930-76324-0004.flac.transcript: but joyce had not been listening all at once she put down her candle on the table and faced her companion

6930-76324-0005.flac.ground: THE TWIN BROTHER DID SOMETHING SHE DIDN'T LIKE AND SHE TURNED HIS PICTURE TO THE WALL
6930-76324-0005.flac.transcript: the twin brother did something she didn't like and she turned his picture to the wall

6930-76324-0006.flac.ground: HERS HAPPENED TO BE IN THE SAME FRAME TOO BUT SHE EVIDENTLY DIDN'T CARE ABOUT THAT
6930-76324-0006.flac.transcript: hers happened to be on the same frame too but she evidently didn't care about it

6930-76324-0007.flac.ground: NOW WHAT HAVE YOU TO SAY CYNTHIA SPRAGUE
6930-76324-0007.flac.transcript: now what have you to say cynthiia brorogue

6930-76324-0008.flac.ground: I THOUGHT WE WERE STUMPED AGAIN WHEN I FIRST SAW THAT PICTURE BUT IT'S BEEN OF SOME USE AFTER ALL
6930-76324-0008.flac.transcript: i thought we were stumped again when i first saw that picture but it's been of some use after all

6930-76324-0009.flac.ground: DO YOU SUPPOSE THE MINIATURE WAS A COPY OF THE SAME THING
6930-76324-0009.flac.transcript: do you suppose the miniature was a copy of the same thing

6930-76324-0010.flac.ground: WHAT IN THE WORLD IS THAT QUERIED JOYCE
6930-76324-0010.flac.transcript: one in the world is it queried joyce

6930-76324-0011.flac.ground: THEY WORRY ME TERRIBLY AND BESIDES I'D LIKE TO SEE WHAT THIS LOVELY FURNITURE LOOKS LIKE WITHOUT SUCH QUANTITIES OF DUST ALL OVER IT GOOD SCHEME CYN
6930-76324-0011.flac.transcript: may worry me terribly and besides i'd like to see what this lovely furniture looks like without such quantities of dust all over it good scheme sin

6930-76324-0012.flac.ground: WE'LL COME IN HERE THIS AFTERNOON WITH OLD CLOTHES ON AND HAVE A REGULAR HOUSE CLEANING
6930-76324-0012.flac.transcript: we'll come in here this afternoon with old clothes on and have a regular house cleaning

6930-76324-0013.flac.ground: IT CAN'T HURT ANYTHING I'M SURE FOR WE WON'T DISTURB THINGS AT ALL
6930-76324-0013.flac.transcript: it can't hurt anything i'm sure for we won't disturb things at all

6930-76324-0014.flac.ground: THIS THOUGHT HOWEVER DID NOT ENTER THE HEADS OF THE ENTHUSIASTIC PAIR
6930-76324-0014.flac.transcript: this thought however did not enter the heads of the enthusiastic pair

6930-76324-0015.flac.ground: SMUGGLING THE HOUSE CLEANING PARAPHERNALIA INTO THE CELLAR WINDOW UNOBSERVED THAT AFTERNOON PROVED NO EASY TASK FOR CYNTHIA HAD ADDED A WHISK BROOM AND DUST PAN TO THE OUTFIT
6930-76324-0015.flac.transcript: smuggling the house cleaning paraphernalia into the cellar window unoberved that afternoon proved no easy task for cynthia had added a whisk broom and dustpan to the outfit

6930-76324-0016.flac.ground: THE LURE PROVED TOO MUCH FOR HIM AND HE CAME SPORTING AFTER IT AS FRISKILY AS A YOUNG KITTEN MUCH TO CYNTHIA'S DELIGHT WHEN SHE CAUGHT SIGHT OF HIM
6930-76324-0016.flac.transcript: the lure proved too much for him and he came sporting after it as friskly as a young kitten much to cynthia's delight when she caught sight of him

6930-76324-0017.flac.ground: OH LET HIM COME ALONG SHE URGED I DO LOVE TO SEE HIM ABOUT THAT OLD HOUSE
6930-76324-0017.flac.transcript: oh let him come along she urged i do love to see him about that old house

6930-76324-0018.flac.ground: HE MAKES IT SORT OF COZIER
6930-76324-0018.flac.transcript: he makes it sort of cosier

6930-76324-0019.flac.ground: NOW LET'S DUST THE FURNITURE AND PICTURES
6930-76324-0019.flac.transcript: now let's dust the furniture and pictures

6930-76324-0020.flac.ground: YET LITTLE AS IT WAS IT HAD ALREADY MADE A VAST DIFFERENCE IN THE ASPECT OF THE ROOM
6930-76324-0020.flac.transcript: yet little as it was it had already made a vast difference in the aspect of the room

6930-76324-0021.flac.ground: SURFACE DUST AT LEAST HAD BEEN REMOVED AND THE FINE OLD FURNITURE GAVE A HINT OF ITS REAL ELEGANCE AND POLISH
6930-76324-0021.flac.transcript: surface dus at least had been removed and the fine old furniture gave a hint of its real elegance and polish

6930-76324-0023.flac.ground: AND MY POCKET MONEY IS GETTING LOW AGAIN AND YOU HAVEN'T ANY LEFT AS USUAL
6930-76324-0023.flac.transcript: and my pocket money is getting low again and you haven't any left as usual

6930-76324-0024.flac.ground: THEY SAY ILLUMINATION BY CANDLE LIGHT IS THE PRETTIEST IN THE WORLD
6930-76324-0024.flac.transcript: they say illumination by candlelight is the prettiest in the world

6930-76324-0025.flac.ground: WHY IT'S GOLIATH AS USUAL THEY BOTH CRIED PEERING IN
6930-76324-0025.flac.transcript: why it's glith as usual they both cried peering in

6930-76324-0026.flac.ground: ISN'T HE THE GREATEST FOR GETTING INTO ODD CORNERS
6930-76324-0026.flac.transcript: isn't he the greatest for getting into odd corners

6930-76324-0027.flac.ground: FORGETTING ALL THEIR WEARINESS THEY SEIZED THEIR CANDLES AND SCURRIED THROUGH THE HOUSE FINDING AN OCCASIONAL PAPER TUCKED AWAY IN SOME ODD CORNER
6930-76324-0027.flac.transcript: forgetting all their weariness they seized their candles and scured through the house finding on occasional paper tucked away in some odd corner

6930-76324-0028.flac.ground: WELL I'M CONVINCED THAT THE BOARDED UP HOUSE MYSTERY HAPPENED NOT EARLIER THAN APRIL SIXTEENTH EIGHTEEN SIXTY ONE AND PROBABLY NOT MUCH LATER
6930-76324-0028.flac.transcript: well i'm convinced that the boarded up house mystery happened not earlier than april sixteenth eighteen sixty one and probably not much later
